elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 owes fA 1/3 mina of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This is remainder of the loan document concerning 5/6 mina of white silver. B1 will pay the silver in Ayyār (II). This is apart from (elat) the remainder (rēhtu) according to the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 2/3 mina of silver due from B2, son of B1, and his mother fB3 for whose payment (eṭēru) C is guarantor (pūtu našû). 4 witnesses (including Šamaš-erība/Iddin-Nabû//Isinnāya and Šamaš-ahu-ittannu/Nidintu, deputy [šanû] of Šamšāya) and the scribe.
 
fA = fTabluṭ/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Šamaš-ēriba/Bēl-iqīša//Isinnāya; B2 = Bēl-iddin/Šamaš-ēriba//Isinnāya; fB3 = fAmtia, mother of B2; C = Nabû-nāṣir; Scribe = Šamaš-kāṣir/Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu

elementText.text: Fragment of a legal record in which Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê and either his wife [Inbāya]/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili or one of her two brothers [Ea-iddin or Nidintu]/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili are mentioned in connection with silver.

elementText.text:
Receipt of dates: In Ulūl (VI) of the present year the scribe A receives from B1 38 kor (6,840 l) of dates which B1 and B2 owe to him and the priest (šangû) of Sippar. It is the income from impost (imittu) of Darius 26th year for the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš in Borsippa, in front of the gate (abullu), on the main road (harrānu rabîtu). 10 kor (1,800 l) out of the total sum were paid to C according to (akî) the letter order (šipirtu) of the two creditors. A returned (târu) the document (šaṭāru) according to which D guarantees (pūtu našû) for B1. A did not receive dates from D on account of B1. B1 has to return to A the letter order of the two creditors. Each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses (including Iddin-Bēl/Ahhē-erība, aramaic scribe of the treasurer [sēpiru ša mašenni]) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšarru (scribe); B1 = Ṭābia/Nabû-ahhē-šullim//Nūr-Papsukkal; B2 = Nabû-lū-šulum/Šūqāya; C = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-ēreš; D = Iddin-Bēt/[–]; Scribe = Zumbu/Ibāya//Šamaš-abāri

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 1,000 kor (180,000 l) of dates. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Sippar in the measure (mašīhu) of the king. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates. 10 witnesses (including the courtier [ša rēš šarri] Nabû-ittia), and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Šamaš-kāṣir

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 15 kor (2,700 l) of dates. The debtor will deliver the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) of 115 kor of dates of A due from (ina muhhi) B, D1, D2 and C. 6 witnesses and the scribe (who is D2).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Arad-Bunene/Na’id-Marduk//Ile’i-Marduk; C = Iddin-Bēl/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Ile’i-Marduk; D1 = Ardia; D2 = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk; Scribe = D2

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the redemption of debts: B swears (tamû) to C by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that on the 10th of Dûzu (IV) of Darius 10th year he will give him in Sippar the dates according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A, property (makkūru) of Šamaš. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bulṭāya/Marduk-erība//Isinnāya; B = Nabû-lū-salim/Rēhētu; C = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Hašdāya/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Adad-šamê

elementText.text:
Clearance of debts: According to the wording of the tablet, an account is drawn up (nikkassu epēšu) concerning 5 5/6 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu), belonging to A: B, on behalf of (ana muhhi) the debtor C, uncle of A, paid (eṭēru) 7 1/3 minas and 2 shekels of silver, including interest (hubullu), to the creditor (rāšû) A. Thereafter A bought the slave woman (qallatu) fD belonging to B. B brought the promissory note (u’iltu) from A and handed it over (našû-nadānu) to the debtor C. Therewith C has been paid 8 minas of silver, price (šīmu) for his female slave (amīltu), by B. In fact, B pays to C 8 minas for fD and sells her for 7 1/3 minas to A. This legal fiction seems to have been established on the background of a dowry payment (BM74548). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; C = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša// Ṣāhit-ginê; fD = fNanāya-šumahūa; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and his wife fB2 owe A 5 kor (900 l) of dates, the remainder (rēhtu) of the harvest of the 3rd year of Darius. They will pay in Tašrīt (VII) on the (ina muhhi) quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-gāmil// Nabûnnāya; fB2 = fBurāšu, wife of B1; Scribe = Līššir/Išparu

A1 = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Nergal-ēṭir; A2= Nabû-šālim, qallu (slave) of C; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Sîn-ibni, šangû (priest) of Opis; Scribe = […]-bi-Šamaš/[…]//[…]-tu

A = Kalbāya/Ṣillāya//Nabāya; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Šigûa

element.description: Museum number of cuneiform tablet

elementText.text:
Dissolution of a joint venture because of death: After the death of A1, father of A2, A2 and B1 together draw up and divide the accounts (nikkassu epēšu zâzu) from the business partnership (harrānu) concerning the capital 5 minas of silver and 190 empty vats invested by A1 and 5 minas of silver and 90 empty vats invested by B1. The business partnership is over – no binding remains. A2 receives in full (mahāru eṭēru) from B1 the 5 minas, with profit (utru), and 190 vats. B1 has taken over the obligation (ana muhhi e’ēlu) of the debt according to the promissory notes (u’iltu) due from (ina muhhi) C1 and C2 respectively. The house received from D and the promissory note concerning 30 kor (5,400 l) of barley, the remainder (rēhtu) of the promissory note concerning 3 minas of silver due from C3, belong to the business partnership between A2 and B2. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša/Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Būru-šēzib; B2 = Nabû-iddin; C1 = Kalbi-Bābu; C2 = Erība/Dummuqu; C3 = Nabû-tukulti-ēdu/Nabû-ušēzib; D = Būru-zēru-iddin; Scribe = Bēl-zēru-ibni/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣāhit-ginê

elementText.text: In a letter to Hašdāya the lower-ranking Bēl-bullissu refers to silver in connection with a certain Iššār-dān in a broken passage and to the workers who came back from Susa. In the end he asks for news from the addressee.

elementText.text:
Lease of a house in Babylon: A rents out to B a house, adjoining the house of C, for 14 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) rent (idū) per year, beginning with next month Dûzu (IV). The lessee shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the remainder (rēhtu) in the middle of the year. He will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the walls (asurrû) and renew the roof (ūru šanû). On the day of Enlil and the kīnayātu-offerings he will make an additional payment (nūptu). 5 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy. An additional witness is mentioned at the very end.
 
A = Adad-ahu-iddin/Būru-zēru-iddin; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-gîne; C = Libluṭ; Scribe = Šamaš-ēṭir/Bēl-uballiṭ

This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 1 mina of silver. 1+ witnesses – remainder of the witness list and the date formula lost.

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 and fB2 owe A 1 mina and 24 shekels of white silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The female slave (amtu) fC, whose hand (qātu, mistake: sag-ti) is inscribed (šaṭāru) with the names of the debtors, is placed as a pledge. 6(+) witnesses and the scribe. The indebted silver is for paying (eṭēru) D, creditor (rāšû) of B1.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit- ginê; B1 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Zababa-napšātu-uṣur/Agru; fB2 = fAya-enqet, daughter (“son” according to text) of B1; fC = fNanāya-lummir, slave of B1; D = Bēl-ṣarbi-nāṣir; Scribe = Bulluṭu/[…]

elementText.text:
Sales of a slave girl: B has voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) given his three-year old female slave (amtu) fC to A for 1/2 mina of silver. If ever there will arise claims (paqāru) on account of (ana muhhi) fC, the seller clear the claims (murruqu) and give her back to her new owner. 8 witnesses and the scribe. Additional note about a statement of B to A that fD has died.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fAna-muhhi-Bēlet-taklāku; fD = fAya-bēlet-la’inni/Nanāya-[x]; Scribe = Tabnēa/Iqīša-Marduk

elementText.text:
Lease of a prebend: A rents out to B the prebend of the temple enterer (isiq ērib bītūti) before Šamaš of Sippar for 2 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) per year. From (ultu) the 1st of Nisān (I), the lessee enjoys the yield (ebūru) of the prebend, that is, the share (zittu) from the offering table (paššūru) comprising [x] kor (liter) of bread, [x] kor (liter) of beer daily and a shoulder cut (imittu, 15 uzu for uzu.15), [broken], honey, wine and 0;0.0.1 kor (1 l) and 1/8 liter (summunu) of pressed (oil) (halṣu) monthly. Each party has taken a copy. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the priest (šangû) of Sippar (Ina-Esagil-lilbur) and the judge (dayyānu) (Nabû-iddin) as well as 3(+) other witnesses. Seal impression (kunukku) of the priest of Sippar (Ina-Esagil-lilbur).
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Balāṭu; B = Marduk-rēmanni (here once mistakenly referred to as Nabû-rēmanni)/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl/Ardia//Atû

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the redemption of debts: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that before (kâdi = kī + adi) the 1st of Šabāṭ (XI) he will come in order to (akî) pay (eṭēru) A1 according to the loan documents concerning donkeys and flock (ṣēnu) of A2 due from (ina muhhi) him. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Šamaš-iddin/Gimil-Šamaš//Bābūtu

elementText.text:
Summoning of a debtor: Until (adi) the end of Ayyār (II) C will bring along (abāku) B to A1 in Sippar in order to draw up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) of the herd (lahru), the shorn wool (gizzatu), the offspring (tamlittu) and the donkeys. If C does not bring B, he has to pay according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2 charged against (ina muhhi) B. All this is apart from (elat) the previous deadline (adannu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; C = Tattannu/Nabû-milkī; Scribe = Munahhiš-Marduk//Mudammiq-Nabû

If he fails to pay, D, whom the creditor has taken as a pledge, will become property of the creditor as full compensation of the claimed silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar; B = Nabû-iddin/Iddin-Nabû//Sîn-karābī; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-[x]//Sîn-imittu

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver: C, deputy (šanû) of A, receives from the scribe (ṭupšarru) of Ebabbar B 3 minas (and [x] shekels) of white silver with stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel for “fitting-out” (rikis qabli) the workers of the king (ṣāb šarri) who are travelling to Susa in the present year under the supervision (ša qātē) of A, the royal resident (qīpu) of Ebabbar. This is in addition (elat) to 307 minas of wool, 0;1 kor (36 l) of salt, 0;1 kor (36 l) of cress (sahlû), 0;1 kor (36 l) of oil and 10 sandals (mešēnu) received from B by C. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamšāya, qīpu (royal resident) of Ebabbar; B = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-līšir/Šangû-Ištar, ṭupšarru (scribe) of Ebabbar; C = Šamaš-ahu-ittannu/Nidintu, šanû (deputy) of A; Scribe = […]//Šangû-[…]

Broken receipt of silver: A, by order of (ina našparti) fC, receives from B [x] amounts of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This is part of the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning the remainder (rēhtu) of the price (šīmu) of a commodity (lost) due from (ina muhhi) B because? (broken) of fC. Another broken passage mentioning D. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Adad-ahu-iddin/Būru-zēru-iddin;  B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = f[…]-a/Gabrī-[…]; D = Nabû-ittannu/[…]; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/[…]

elementText.text:
Lease of a house: A rents out to B a house for 7 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne) rent (idū) per year, beginning with the 1st of Ulūl (VI). Most of the information about the exact location of the rented house is lost, but it is said to adjoin a bīt kuruppi-warehouse and the house of C. The lessee shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the remainder (rēhtu) in the middle of the year. The lessor already received the full rent for the first year and the lessee will make an additional gift (nūptu) in Dûzu (IV) and Kislīm (IX). Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-zēri/Šaddinnu //Itinnu; C = […]/Nergal-šēzib; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ

elementText.text:
Sale of a slave woman: B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sells his slave woman (qallatu) fC to A for 2 ½ minas cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. If ever there will arise claims (paqāru) of the seller concerning fC, he will clear the claims (murruqu) and give her back to her new owner. 9 witnesses (including Iddin-Nabû/Bēl-zēru-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Iddin-Marduk/Ile’i-bulluṭ-Marduk//Nappāhu; fC = fŠulum-Bābili; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Taqīš-Gula/Egibi

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes the royal merchant (tamkār šarri) A 5 minas of cut silver (nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. Beginning with the first day of Tašrīt (VII), the debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-mukīn-apli/Šeru-hanan, tamkār šarri (royal merchant); B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-iqīša/Taqīš-Gula//Dābibī

Oath concerning the delivery of barley: B swears (tamû) to C by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will give him 20 kor (3,600 l) of barley on the 2nd of Tašrīt (VII) in Sippar. The barley is part of the claim (rašûtu) of the brothers A1 and A2. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Itti-Bēl-lummir/Bēl-ēreš; A2 = Gimil-Šamaš/Bēl-ēreš; B = Nādinu/Hašdaya; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Erība-Marduk//Rē’i-sisê

elementText.text:
Loan of dates and barley: B1 owes A 600 kor (108,000 l) of dates and 400 kor (72,000 l) of barley, capital sum (qaqqadu) and interest (hubullu). B1 will give 100 kor (18,000 l) of dates in Arahsamna (VIII) and 50 kor (9,000 l) of barley in Ayyār (II). C, slave (qallu) of B1, guarantees (pūtu našû) for the full payment. The dates and barley are part of the credit (rašûtu) due from B2, grandfather of B1. 11 witnesses and the scribe. A has not received anything on behalf of (ana muhhi) D1 and D2. Seal impression (kunukku) of B1.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Erība-Marduk/Nidinti-Marduk;  B2 = Bēlšunu/Nabû-nāṣir, grandfather of B1; C = Šamšāya/Niqūdu, slave of B1, D1 = Gimil-Šamaš/Bēl-ēreš; D2 = Itti-Bēl-lummir/Bēl-ēreš; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Erība-Marduk

elementText.text:
Fragment of a lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2. The details about the leased prebends are lost, but compare with BM72761, BM74504 and BM63824. The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (of the performance of the cult). They will give monthly to fA1 (as far as preserved) 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (mubannûtu). The income from the other prebends (including the prebend of the oil-presser) given to fA1 is not preserved. 3+ witnesses (including Bēl-bullissu/Marudk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe (name lost).
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Iddināya/Nidintu//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta; B2= Šamaš-kāṣir/Šellibi; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal

elementText.text:
Summon to hand over the promissory note: Until (adi) the 2nd of Tašrīt (VII), A will bring to B2 and hand over (našû-nadānu) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 4 1/3 minas of silver, claim (rašûtu) of A due from (ina muhhi) B1, father of B2. B1, father of B2. There are no claims left – even if the promissory note turns up somewhere. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Seal impression (kunukku) of the priest (šangû) of Sippar (Nādin-ahi).
 
A = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Marduk-bēl-napšāti//Šangû-Šamaš; B1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-rē’išunu/Rēmūt-bēl-ili//Bēl-eṭēru

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver amounts: A receives from B [x] amounts of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This amount is divided into 22 shekels of silver for [x], 20 shekels of silver for the bow-service (qaštu) of kanšû-duty, [x] shekels of silver for support troops of the service (lúši-i-di ša našparti) and [x] shekels of silver that are given to C as urāšu on account of (ana muhhi) B. Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Broken additional clause in the end.
 
A = Nergal-ibni/Tabnēa//Nabûtu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Kalbāya; Scribe = [x]-Marduk/[GN]-kāṣir

The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The bīt kuruppi- warehouse on the quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar), bordering the houses of C1 and C2, is placed as a pledge. 8 witnesses and the scribe.

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that on the 1st of Ṭebēt he will come (alāku) and draw up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) of the flock (ṣēnu), the wool and the donkeys according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2 and the accounts of the ½ mina of silver due from him – in this case there is no promissory note. He will pay (eṭēru) the silver to A1. 6 witnesses (including Šamaš-ahu-iddin/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl- uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqiša//Ṣāhit-gine

elementText.text:
Lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2 for 5 years (according to an additional clause at the end of the contract). This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûtu) in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitūtu) of the first 15 days of Tašrīt (VII) as well as 13 sweet cakes (muttāqu) of the whole year. The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. They will give to the lessor 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates, 1 takkašu loaf (ṣibtu ša takkaši), 2/3 of a vat (bītu) of billatu-beer and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the mubannûtu-prebend and 0;0.1.1 kor (7 l) of sesame, 30 containers (kindu) of pressed sesame (kupsu) and 0;0.0.0.5 kor (½ l) of sesame oil from the prebend of the oil-presser. For the prebend of sweet cakes (muttāqūtu) the lessor receives 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of emmer (kunāšu), 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of sesame and 0;0.0.1.5 kor (1 ½ l) and 1/16 liter (ahu summunu, “half share of 1/8 liter”) of honey. 7 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy. Additional penalty clause: The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay 5 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû).
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Ahušunu/Uballissu-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B2= Iddināya/Nidintu//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal

elementText.text: Fragment of a legal document mentioning Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, scribe of Ebabbar (ṭupšar Ebabbar), in connection with 22 kor (3,960 l) of salt meant for the regular offerings (sattukku) of Šamaš. elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B, slave of C, owes A 3 kor (540 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in Ayyār (II). This is apart from (elat) to the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 600 kor (108,000 l) of dates and 400 kor (72,000 l) of barley of A due from C for whose payment (eṭēru) B guarantees (pūtu našû). 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamšāya, slave of C; C = Erība-Marduk; Scribe = Tabnēa/Iqīša-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the handing-over of a loan document: C swears (tamû) to B by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that on the 10th of Tašrīt (VII) he will give the tablet of A to him. The tablet is concerned with 7 minas of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel and one lapis lazuli (uqnû) which A deposited (paqādu) together with C. 8 witnesses (including Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Balāṭu and Libluṭ/Arad-Marduk//Bēliya’u, enterers of the Marduk Temple [ērib bīt Marduk]) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bulluṭ/Nabû-iddin//Amēl-Ea, C = Nabû-bullissu/Lâbâši//Šangû-Gula; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl/Ardia//Atû

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe A 1 mina of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt bears a monthly interest of one shekel silver per mina (20% p.a.). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Adad-ahu-iddin/Adad-nādin-zēri; B1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = […]/[…]//Basia; Scribe = B1

elementText.text:
Lease of arable land for joint cultivation: A rents out for cultivation (ana errēšūti nadānu) 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land (zēru) to B. 15 kor of the land are located in the hūpu-land and administered by D1. The other 15 kor of land are located in the hammašatu-land and administered by D2. Both form part of the crown land (nakkandu ša šarri) under the responsbility of C, deputy (šanû) of the treasurer (mašennu), and were rented by A for cultivation (ana errēšūti ṣabātu). Lessor and lessee will plough (erēšu) the land together and share the costs for transport (gimru) and for the removing (nasāhu), to be paid to the administrators D1 and D2, as well as the costs for the farmer (ikkaru). Broken passage. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Niqūdu, slave (qallu) of Bēlšunu; C = Bēl-šumu-iškun; D1= Nādinu; D2 = Kalbāya; Scribe = Šamaš-zēru-ušebši/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Dābibī

elementText.text:
Lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûti) in Ebabbar in Sippar for 3 months and 10 days, that is, the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitūtu) of the first 15 days of Tašrīt (VII) as well as 13 sweet cakes (muttāqu) of the whole year of the “greeting-of-the-temple” ceremonies (šalām bīti). They will give to fA1 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates, 1 takkašu loaf (ṣibtu ša takkaši), 2/3 of a vat (bītu) of billatu-beer and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the mubannûtu-prebend and 0;0.1.1 kor (7 l) of sesame, 30 containers (kindu) of pressed sesame (kupsu) and 0;0.0.0.5 kor (½ l) of sesame oil from the prebend of the oil-presser. For the prebend of sweet cakes (muttāqūtu) fA1 receives 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of emmer (kunāšu), 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of sesame and 0;0.0.1.5 kor (1 ½ l) of honey (dišpu, di-ip-šú). The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses (including Kuṣurāya/Nidintu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili) and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Libluṭ/Guzānu//Balīhu; B2= Ahušunu/Uballissu-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-ittannu//Šangû-Ištar

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute concerning a prebend: After B gave to A the prebend of the oil presser (isiq ṣāhitūti) before Bēl in Esagil for an amount of silver, he states that the prebend is his and that A is not the his nephew. The bishop (šatammu) of Esagil (GN-ahu-iddin) checked the copy (šaṭāru) in question and [gave back to A?]. Another broken sentence concerning the charging (manû) of the credit (rašûtu). Passage broken. 6 witnesses (all ērib bīti of Marduk) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ, (deceased?) father of Marduk-remanni; B = Dādia/Kabtia//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = [Ša-GN]-šū//Šarru-arazû

elementText.text:
Receipt of sheep: A, in the name (ina šumi, usually: ana šumi) of C, receives from B 30 female lambs (parratu). The payment takes place in accordance with what is provided in the promissory note (u’iltu) of C. Until (adi) the 1st of Tašrīt (VII) the creditor will bring the debt note and hand it over (našû-nadānu) to the debtor. 8 witnesses (including Bēl-šarru-uballiṭ, courtier [ša rēš šarri]) and the scribe. This document is linked to BM114712.
 
A = […]; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Zēr-Bābili/Muṭēriṣu; Scribe = Nidintu-Marduk/[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 37 kor (6,660 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the field (eqlu) in Du(r)bissu. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. Passage broken. With each kor of dates he will give palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fibres (mangagu) and [broken]. 2 witnesses and the scribe. The wages in dates (sissinnu) are not yet paid off (eṭēru Stat.).

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//Uballissu-Marduk; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Sîn-imittu

elementText.text:

Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay. A certain object (broken) is placed as a pledge. 4 witnesses (including the coutier [ša rēš šarri] Terrik-šarrussu) and the scribe.
 
A = Balāṭu/Nabû-tukulti-ēdu; B1 = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu//Nergal-uballiṭ; fB2 = fNūptāya, wife of B1; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya

elementText.text:
Establishment of a business partnership: A invests 8 minas of silver for a business partnership (harrānu) with B and C as active partners. C will run the business (našpartu alāku) instead of his brother A and together with B. Whatever B will generate from (ina muhhi) the 8 minas of silver, he and C each will enjoy (akālu) a half share (ahi zitti) in the profit (utru). B shall not make extra costs (etēqu etēqu) without the consent of A. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of the invested silver without interest (qaqqadu). 3(+) witnesses (including Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/Bēl-erība, father of B, and Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša //Ṣahit-ginê) and the scribe (name lost).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-mukīn-apli/Šamaš-aplu-uṣur//Pahhāru; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê

elementText.text:
Partly broken dialogue document concerning an adoption of a son: fB approaches A, her son-in-law, and asks him to adopt (ana mārūti nadānu) his eldest son C, her grandson. A grants the request (šemû) and entrusts C. fB will voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) give the adoptee 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of bread and 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of first quality (rēštu) beer, income of the prebend of the temple-enterer (isiq ērib bītūti) in Egukug(a), the Ziqqurrat of Sippar, which [PN] had given to her in a sealed tablet as compensation for 10 minas of silver. Large gap. The adoptee will provide his adoptive mother with food (ipru), ointment (piššatu) and clothing (lubuštu). He will grow up at her place and enjoy the usufruct of her assets (nikkassu) as long as she lives and receive her assets when she dies (ana šīmti alāku). She will not adopt any other son. Broken passage and gap. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; fB = fZazītu/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Bā’iru; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk/Šangû-Šamaš; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Bēl-ibni//Gahal

elementText.text:
Lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûti) in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitu) of the first half of Tašrīt (VII) as well as 13 sweet cakes (muttāqu) of the whole year. The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. They will give to the lessor (from what is preserved) 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates, 1 takkašu loaf (ṣibtu ša takkaši), 2/3 of a vat of good quality (babbanû) billatu-beer and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the mubannûtu-prebend and 30 containers (kindu) of pressed sesame (kupsu) and 1/16 liter (ahu summunu, “half share of 1/8 liter”) honey. The income for the lessor of the prebend of sweet cakes (muttāqūtu) is entirely lost. 4 witnesses (including Kuṣurāya/Nidintu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili and Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-ittannu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili) and the scribe. Additional penalty clause: The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay 5 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû).
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Iddināya/Nidintu//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta; B2= Šamaš-kāṣir/Šellibi//[…]; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal

elementText.text:
Fragment of a lease of a prebend (comparable to BM78165): fA1, widow of A2, gives prebends for the performance of the duties to B. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna and the prebend of the oil-presser. From the income B will deliver to fA1 emmer (kunāšu), 1/8 liter (summunu) honey and sesame. 2+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; A2 = Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Iddin-Nabû; Scribe = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Šūzubu//Ile’i-Marduk

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 1/3 minas of white silver (kaspu ṣepû) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the silver, without interest (qaqqadu), in Nisān (I). He has to pay this silver as a penalty for the flock (ṣēnu) which is illegally seized property (ṣibtūti) of A. It is instead of cutting off (batāqu) his hand (rittu). 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nusku-īnāya/Nusku-ayalu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Basia/[…]//Bēl-eṭēru

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 7;2.3 kor (1,350 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of Du(r)bissu. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). With each kor of dates he will supply palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fronds (libbu), date palm fibres (mangagu) and loads of palm-frond ribs (biltu ša huṣābi). The wages in dates (sissinnu) are not yet paid off (eṭēru Stat.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Ṣillāya//Mušēzib; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir//Šangû-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes 34(+) kor (6,120 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of A. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu and in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). With each kor of dates he will give loads (of palm-frond ribs) (biltu [ša huṣābi]), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fibres (mangagu), date palm fronds (libbu), one (container of) pressed dates (darīku) and one basket of palm feathers (qappatu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//Uballissu-Marduk; Scribe = Hahhūru/[PN]

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 ½ minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). This loan document is apart from (elat) previous promissory notes (u’iltu). 5 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ina-rēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê

elementText.text:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B1 swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl and Nabû that he will give to him 1/3 mina of silver, claim (rašûtu) of A2, father of A1, due from B2, father of B1, on the 10th of Ṭebēt (X). It is from the share (pūt zitti) of B1 which he holds (našû) together with his brothers. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 5/6 mina of silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Kiribti-Marduk/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-ēreš//Aya-tabni

elementText.text:
Establishment of a business partnership: A invests 10 minas of silver and B invests 5 1/3 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel for a business partnership (harrānu) with B and C as active partners. C will run the business (našpartu alāku) instead of his brother A and together with B. Whatever they will generate from (ina muhhi) the sum of 15 1/3 minas of silver, A and B each will enjoy (akālu) a half share (ahi zitti) in the profit (utru). Beginning with Dûzu (IV), B and C will yearly pay 20 shekel of silver from the commonly held property (karû) as rent (idū) for the house to A. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk

elementText.text:
Partly broken dialogue document concerning a settlement about a promissory note: By order or (ina pî) a certain C (perhaps the father of the mayor), A approaches (mahāru) the priest (šangû) of Sippar (Marduk-šumu-iddin) because of a promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 15 minas of silver which has been declared(?) by the mayor (hazannu) of Sippar (Šamaš-ibni/Nabû-uṣalla) to B. According to a broken passage, B probably needed it for a trip to Uruk. B will bring the promissory note to the mayor in Tašrīt (VII). The judicial settlement (purussî dīnu) took place in the names of the priest of Sippar, the temple enterer (ērib bīti) of Šamaš (Bēl-aplu-iddin//Šangû-Sippar), two more individuals and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-ibni/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/Bānia//Pahhāru; C = Nabû-uṣalla; Scribe = Arad-Bēl/Bēl-ušallim//Adad-šamê

The remainder he will pay in Arahsamna (VIII). fC guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of the dates. Seal impressions (kunukku) of the judges Nabû-balassu-iqbi and the Huziri. The contract is drawn up in the presence of (ina mahar) 4 witnesses (including the two judges) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-muballissu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Imbu-īnāya; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-ittannu/Rēmūt-Bēl//Naggāru

Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû) in view of the payment. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of the silver. 6 witnesses and the scribe.

The remainder of the tablet is destroyed.

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 55 kor (9,900 l) of dates. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII). 3 witnesses (including Aplāya/Mušēzib-Marduk//Balīhu) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ittannu/Arad-Bēl//Balīhu; Scribe = Bēl-ibni//Gahal

elementText.text:
Broken loan of vats: B owes A 8 empty old vats with bitumen (kupru), damaged (batqu) and leaky (gurrušu *gurruru). The debtor will deliver the vats in Dûzu (IV). 3(+) witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Adad-Bēl-sihi(h)ti/Būru-šēzib; B = Ardia/Kīnāya; Scribe = Bēl-kāṣir/Bēl-bullissu

elementText.text:
Broken receipt of silver payments: A, by order of (ina qībi) C, receives from B a broken amount of what seems to be silver, paid for the rent of a certain month (the name of which is broken off) of Darius 11th year. This includes (adi) the [previous claim] for 5 minas of silver that was still pending. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Murānu; B = Dādia/[…]-ahhē-iddin; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = […]/Ardia//[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 minas of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel and 1 ½ minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) of 1/8 alloy per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). This loan document is apart from (elat) to the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver. 4 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Tēši-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 owes A 20 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) and 10 shekels of refined silver (kaspu qalû). B1 will pay in Dûzu (IV). The silver is given to B2, father of B1, for cattle. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-etel-ilāni//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Nabû-etel-ilāni//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina and 12 shekels of silver. The debtor will pay on the 15th of Tašrīt (VII). D, slave (qallu) of the debtor and baker (nuhatimmu), is placed as a pledge. Beginning with the next day, that is, 5th of Abu (V), D will give a compensation payment (mandattu) to the creditor instead of interest (hubullu). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. Being the orginal creditor, C has no more claims (rašûtu). 2 witnesses (including Taqīš-Gula/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. The text is linked to the sale document BM74988.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Isinnāya; C = Mušallim-Marduk/Lâbâši//Ša-nāšišu; D = Ina-ṣilli-Bīt-Akītu; Scribe = C

elementText.text:
Partly transfer of dowry: On the basis of the document (u’iltu) concerning 4 minas of silver, dowry (nudunnû) of fC, A receives from (his father-in-law) B1 ½ mina of silver. 2 witnesses (Iqīša/Dayyān-Marduk, father of A, and Bazuzu, son of B1) and the scribe. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ašābi) fB2, mother of the bride fC and wife of B1. Each party has taken one (exemplar of the text) so there should be no retracting (enû).
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Šamaš-mukīn-apli/Mušēzib-Bēl//Balīhu; fB2 = fZazītu, mother of fC and wife of B1; fC = fBu’ītu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli//Balīhu; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê

elementText.text:
Partly transfer of dowry: Along with his daughter fC, B promised to give as a dowry (nudunnû) 4 minas of silver, the (slave) D1 and 55 shekels of silver, the price (šīmu) of fD2, probably a weaver (iš-x-x-tu4, [išpartu]), to A. From these items, he herewith gives the silver amount for fD2. 5+ witnesses (including Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu) and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Mukīn-zēri//Balīhu; B = Bēl-kāṣir/Nabû-šumu-šakin//Sîn-šadûnu; fC = fSunnā; D1 = Nabû-dīnī-īpuš; fD2 = fPān-nanāya-adaggal, išpartu(?) (weaver); Scribe = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Balassu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili

elementText.text: Expenditures of gold and golden objects for a breast ornament of Bēltu-ša-Rēš during times of hardship: Kudurrānu receives 11 ½ shekels of gold, remainder of the gold for the breast ornament (irtu) of Bēltu-ša-Rēš, comprising 51 mountings (mandītu) for cylinder seals, 25 golden pomegranates (nurmû), 21 chains (harharu), 27 rings (sanhu), 25 zuburinnu (mng. unknown) of golden pomegranates and 27 gi’nâtu ša summuhu (gi-i’-na-a-ta ˹šá su˺-um-m[u], mng. unknown) for the golden breast ornament of Bēltu-ša-Rēš.  This administrative procedure happened during the locking of the gate (edel bābi), that is, during times of hardship.

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute between father and son: Father B and his son A have mutually agreed upon (gamālu D, see comment Zadok and Zadok 2005: 626–7) that 735 square cubits (183.75 m2) of land located in front of the city gate which has been given to C1 as well as 392 square cubits (98 m2) of a house bordering on the house of D which have been given to C2, together with 4 minas of silver, belong to A. 8 witnesses (including Šamaš-zēru-iqīša/Arkāt-ilī-damqāti, governor [šākin ṭēmi] of Borsippa; Nabû-nādin-šumi/Nūr-Papsukkal, temple-enterer [ērib bīti] and bishop [šatammu] of Ezida) and the scribe, also identified as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi).
 
A = Bēl-ikṣur/Zarātu; B = Zarātu, father of A; C1 = Ša-Nabû-šū; C2 = Silim-ilu; D = Useppi; Scribe = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Barīhu

elementText.text: List of date gardens and their gardeners in Uruk: 7 groups of altogether 47 date gardens with length measures of 40 up to 800 cubits (20 – 400 m). Out of the 47 gardens, 43 gardens are located inside of Uruk and the remaining 4 next to the city wall at the Hariṣu Canal and the Harri Canal.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver: B1 and B2 owe A ½ mina and 1 shekel of silver. It is an interest-free debt (hubuttūtu). 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya; B1 = Bēl-šumu-iškun; B2 = Bēl-iddin//Dan-Adad; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Šangû-Šamaš-Bābili

elementText.text:
Loan of reed: B owes 30 talents of reed, property (nikkassu) of the Šamaš Temple, including the former reed B took from C as collateral (ana nishi našû). The debt sum will increase by a corresponding amount (ana birâ). B will give it back in the month Šabāṭ (XI). 3 witnesses (including Ibnāya from the Isinean family) and the scribe.
 
B = Nabû-[…]/Bēl-usāti//Isinean; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Ša-nāšišu; Scribe = Etellu//Bēl-ēṭeru

elementText.text:
Sale of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC to A1, A2 and A3. B guarantees against claimants. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Arad-Gula; A2 = Dannēa; A3 = Ninurta-uballiṭ; B = Ea-ibni; fC = fAlannišu

elementText.text:
Receipt of land: A1 and A2 receive land with its front measuring 100 cubits (50 m). It is located on the bank (kišādu) of the Euphrates and beneath (šupālu) the reed huts (huṣṣu) of C and forms part of the hanšû-land of D. A1 guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of land with a front measuring 50 cubits (25 m), that is, half of the land. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A1 = Aplāya//Nusku-iddin; A2 = Bēl-ušallim//Egibi; B = Zākiru//Rab-tarbāṣi; C = Bēl-ēṭir; D = Nabû-ēreš//Sîn-ili; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: 1 mina of silver belonging to A is at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. B will repay the capital sum (qaqqadu) of the debt at the opening of the gate (ina petî bābi). 2 female witnesses (Šarrāya and Etellītu, two daughters of Erība-Marduk) and his (the creditor’s) own scribe (ṭupšarru ramanišu).
 
A = Šamaš-iddin//Nabû-useppi; B = Balāssu//Šumāya; Scribe = Šamaš-zēru-iqīša//Aplāya

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1, B2 and B3 owe A 2 minas of silver. The debtors should pay the debt on the 5th day of the following month (II), that is, within c. one week. If they fail to pay on time, the debt will bear a daily interest of 1/2 shekel. 3 witnesses and the scribe who is identical with B3.
 
A = Enlil-šumu-iddin//Murašû; B1 = Nāˀid-Marduk//[…]-ati; B2 = Nabû-šumu-līšir//Ṣāhit-ginê; B3 = Arad-Gula//Bāˀiru; Scribe = B3

elementText.text:
Purchase of a storage shed: A purchases from B a storage shed (bīt šutummi), finished with roof and doors, for 3 minas and 10 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 kor of dates. The shed is located in the pure storage shed of Ezida. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the storage shed of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the shed of C2. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the wide street (sūqu rapšu), the processional road (mālaku), and its lower front (in the east) on the shed of C3. The storage shed covers an area of 588 square cubits (147 m2). The purchase price is based on the price of 15 5/6 shekel of silver per 49 square cubits (12.25 m2) field. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-kudurrī-uṣur//Irˀanni-Marduk, ērib bīti (temple-enterer) of Marduk; B = Bēl-uballiṭ//Amīlāya, brewer (sirāšu) of Marduk; C1 = Bēl-īpuš/Aplāya; C2 = Etillu//Ilšu-abūšu; C3 = Nabû-iddin//Arkāt-ilāni; Scribe = Bēl-[…]//Rāši-ili

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver: C1 owes A via B 3 minas of silver. The debt is secured by the pledged property (bīt maškani) of C1 received from C2, C3 and his mother fC4. He won’t get these assets back. The remainder is with A. 9 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šāpik-zēri; B = Kudurru/Bēl-eṭēru//Šangû-Dilbat; C1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Lâbâši//Basia; C2 = Nabû-ittabši-līšir; C3 = Marduk-šumu-ibni; fC4 = fBēlessunu, mother of C1; Scribe = Etellu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a garden for 24.5 shekels of silver from B. The sold garden forms part of the hanšû-land of C. It borders on the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal) and the royal road (harrān šarri) as well as on the properties of D1 and D2. 2 witnesses and the scribe, also described as writers of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). This is a retroact for Marduk-šāpik-zēri//Egibi.
 
A = Mukīn-zēri//Basia; B = Uraš-lēˀi//Šāpiku; C = Iddina//Zākiru; D1 = Ubār/Uraš-iddin; D2 = Ammēni-ilī/Nanāya; Scribe = Rēmūtu/Uraš-ibni

elementText.text:
Dialogue document about a settlement of a dispute concerning small livestock: A files a suit against B saying that he did not receive a share of the revenue of the sale of 27 small livestock animals. The assembly of the Babylonians and Dilbateans sent them to the ordeal of the 14th of Addar (XII). A will give 1 mina of silver and B 2 minas of silver. They will go to the ordeal on the 4th of Abu (V). 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir; B = Nabû-šumu-ēreš; Scribe = Nabû-ahu-iddin//Bāˀiru

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Ištar of Uruk for 15 days, from the 1st to the 15th day of Nisān (I) of the following year (Kandalanu 18), for 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 shekels of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Naˀid-Marduk). 6 witnesses  and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) (of the seller).
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Nādin/Bēl-ušallim; Scribe = Mukīn-zēri/Zabīdāya

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] mina of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with the month Kislīm (IX), the debt will bear an interest of 8 shekels per mina (13.3% p.a.). 1 square kor (13,500 m2) of land, situated beneath the Canal of the Mulberry (harru ša ṣarbi), is placed as a pledge. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Nabû-ibni//Šigûa; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-uṣur//Egibi

elementText.text:
Purchase of land and an empty house: A purchases three parcels of land for 34(+?) minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The three parcels of land include the half share (ahu) of an orchard (kirû), an empty house plot (bītu kišubbû) and a piece of grain-cultivated land (zēru pî šulpi). The orchard is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side, its lower side and its upper front borders on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front follows the royal canal (nār šarri). No cardinal directions for the sides of the orchard are given. The empty house plot is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Market Gate (bāb mahīri) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the west) borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king and its lower side (in the east) on the house of C4. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house(s) of C5 and C6 and its lower front (in the south) on the narrow street (sūqu qatnu). The plot of cultivated land is located in the meadowland of the Angillu irrigation district (tamirtu) and along the upper (elû) royal canal (nār šarri) in the meadowland of Uruk. Neither cardinal directions for the sides nor any other information about the bordering areas are given. No side lengths are given for any of the three plots. All this is the (inheritance) share (zittu) which B2, the father of the seller, received from B3, the grandfather of the seller. 15 witnesses (including the priest [šangû] of Larsa) and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu/Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Šulāya/Ṭābia; B2 = Šulāya/Ahhēa/Ṭābia; B3 = Ahhēa/Aplāya/Ṭābia; C1 = Kudurru//Nabû-naˀid; C2 = Nādinu//Ērešu; C3 = Pirˀu//Bēl-useppi; C4 = Ilūˀa/Šullumu; C5 = […]/Šullumu; C6 = Nabû-erība//Šāpiku; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bāba//Arkât-ilī

elementText.text:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 2 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B. The sold house is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Market Gate (bāb mahīri) inside of Uruk. Its upper and lower side (in the north and south) as well as upper front (in the west) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front (in the east) borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. It measures 55 x 30 cubits (27.5 x 15 m). The seller has taken an oath (nīšu zakāru) by the god Marduk well as his divine spouse Zarpanītu and by the king. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the leader of the tribe Bīt-Amukāni (Ea-zēru-(i)qīša). 12 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Ahu-iddin-Marduk/Aplāya; C1 = Ibnāya//Ahu-šubši; C2 = Nabû-ušēzib/Dāmiru; C3 = Nanāya-īpuš/Pirˀu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-līšir//Nabû-zēru-ukīn

elementText.text: Expenditures of silver for the kettles before Bēltia and Nanāya during times of hostilities in the land: Out of the capital sum (qaqqadu) of 27 minas and 13 shekels of silver, at the disposal of (ina pāni) Nabû-zēru-ibni for the repair (batqu) of kettles (taphu) before the potstand (kankannu) of Bēltia and Nanāya, he weighed (hâṭu) and used 24 ½ minas and 1 shekel of silver, that is, 16 ½ minas and one shekel as the first supply (hāṭu) and 8 minas as the second supply. These 24 ½ minas and 1 shekel of silver will be recast (patāqu), while the remainder of 2 1/3 minas and 3 shekels of silver, together with 19 shekels ina parīdānu (mng. unknown), won’t be recast.

elementText.text:
Purchase of a field: A purchases a field (eqlu) for 13 shekels of silver from B. The sold field is located on the other river bank (ahullā) and forms part of the hanšû-land of Nabû-zēru-iddin. It reaches from the Euphrates as far as Larak. Curses. 5 witnesses and the scribe who is identical with B.
 
A = Ninurta-ahu-iddin/Bēl-usātu; B = Ninurta-erība/Uballiṭua; Scribe = B

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases from B the prebend of the scribe (isiq ṭupšarrūti) in the house of the dates (bīt gišimmari) of Ezida (Nabû Temple) for 4 months for 5 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The sold prebend affords Dilmun dates, regular dates, emmer (kunāšu), salt, sesame, honey, ghee (himētu), nabrû-offerings, sweet bread (mutqû), siltu-groates and other food rations (kurummatu) together with 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of sesame being under the responsibility of (ina qātē) of C. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the temple-enterer (ērib bīti) of Nabû and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal) as well as the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Ilia). 7 witnesses (including Nabû-ušēzib, “the one in charge of the rations of the king” [ša-muhhi-kurummāti-šarri“] and Šumāya from the Basia family) and the scribe, who like the buyer, belongs to the Balāṭu family. Along with the entry of the witness Šumāya it is said that 10 kor (1,800 l) of barley and a garment (TÚG.KUR.RA) are given. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir//Balāṭu; B = Tabnēa//Basia; C = Aplāya//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-iddin//Balāṭu

elementText.text: Administrative document concerning a royal land grant: 91 officials in charge of hanšû-land (rab hanšê) each receive 150 of x-measure land from the king. The granted land reaches from the bank of the Canal of Marduk-apla-iddina as far as the border of Bīt-Zu-gunabu. It is determined that 1,100 of x-measure “of the temple” equal to 1,000 of x-measure “of the king.” Note that the measurement unit is never given along with the numbers.

elementText.text:
Purchase of a date garden: A purchases from B a planted and cultivated (zaqpu u pî šulpi) date garden (kirî gišimmari) for [x] amounts of silver. The plot of land is located in the area of Bīt-Zabīni in the district (pīhatu) of Uruk. Its upper side (in the east) and its upper front (in the north) border on (the properties of) C, presumably the father of the buyer. Its lower side (in the west) borders on the bank (kišādu) of the Harru-ša-nēri canal. The bordering area of the lower front (in the south) is not specified. No dimensions are given. In connection with the upper side and the lower side it is stated that they have to be measured out (madādu). The remainder of the main text body and the beginning of the witness list are broken. 6+ witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-aplu-uṣur/Ina-tēšî-ēṭir; B = Bēlšunu/Nabû-ušallim; C = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Rēmūtu; Scribe = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Bēl-ahhē-erība

elementText.text:
Cancellation of a purchase of land during hard times: A purchases 0;4 square kor (10,800 m2) of land with young date palms for silver from B at times when the gate was locked (edel bābi). The land is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Bazia, in the meadowland (ugāru) of Dilbat, and forms part of the hanšû-land of C. The purchase is cancelled. A receives back his money and gives the tablet to the seller. 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ša-pî-Uraš//Salāmu; B = Šamaš-iddin//Bā’iru; C = Uraš-iddin//Saggillu; Scribe = Lâbâši-Marduk/Iddin-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Cancellation of a purchase of a prebend: According to the annihilated tablet (ṭuppi šiprēti), A has purchased the prebend of the temple-enterer (ērib bītūti) in the Eimbianu, the Uraš Temple, before Bēlet-ekalli for 2 minas and 2 shekels of silver from B. However, C raises claim on the sold property since it is family estate. The purchase is cancelled and the prebend is property of C. 11(+) witnesses and the scribe.

A = Kudurru/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Šangû-Dilbat; B = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi; C = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Erība-Marduk//Egibi; Scribe = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Bēl-ipuš/Egibi

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Bēltia from the [x]th to the 21st day (of the present month) for 6 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-šumu-iddin). 4 witnesses (including Ahu-lūmur, a son of A) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Rēmūtu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B = Līširu/Nādin-apli; Scribe = Nādin-apli /Kunāya

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.7% p.a.). 10 square kor (135,000 m2) of land, bordering the wine house (bīt karāni) of B2, is placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses and the scribe, who is identical with B2.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni//Šangû-Zāriqu; B2 = Aplāya//Nābutu; Scribe = B2

elementText.text:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 50 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of one woolen garment (TÚG.KUR.RA), from B. The sold house is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the north) and its upper front (in the west) border on houses already owned by the buyer. Its lower front (in the east) borders on the house of C and its lower side (in the south) borders on a blind alley (biriti lā aṣîti). No side lengths are given in the record. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 10 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Nabû-ēreš/Hašdia; C = Ahhēšāya/Nanāya-uṣalli; Scribe = Balāṭu/Bēl-lēˀi

elementText.text: Inventory of precious metals (and other precious materials like stone) for the manufacture of a golden tiara: In sum 29 (minas) and 15? shekels of red gold, including  1 mina and 14 ½ shekels of refined copper, are made available for the manufacture of a golden tiara (agû) for the goddess Uṣur-amāssu. As finished work (dullu epšu) the tiara will combine 47 5/6 minas and 16 ½ shekels red gold. The document was written by Širikti-Marduk/Ibni-Ištar, scribe (ṭupšarru) of Eanna.

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a prebend: B1 and B2 approach A with a request to buy the prebend of the temple scribe (ṭupšar bītūti) of (literally) their father, and their entire assets (nikkassu ša āli u ṣēri), for 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu). A grants the request and weighs out and pays (hâṭu-nadānu) the money in order to receive a sealed tablet (kunukku) over the ownership of the prebend of the temple scribe. The amount of 50 shekels of silver is the outstanding amount of 2 minas and 40 shekels of silver less 1 mina 50 shekels of silver which belong to (ana muhhi pî) C1 and C2, (literally) brothers of B1 and B2. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Ur (Sîn-tabni-uṣur). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-ahu-uṣur/Bēl-iqīša, ša-qurbūti and Sîn-šarru-uṣur, scout [dayālu]) and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the two sellers. In case B1 comes to Ur, A will voluntarily (in hūd libbi) give him the house located next to D as well as the prebend (isqu) before the Lady of Ur. In case B1 does not come to Ur, this property will remain in the possession of A.
 
A = Ningal-ušēzib/Palil-iddin; B1 = Balāssu/Sîn-bār-ilāni/Halluršu; B2 = Ahhū-ṭābū/Nabû-šumu-iddin/Nabû-nāṣir; C1 = Aplāya; C2 = Nabû-mudammiq-ilī; D = Sîn-iddin/Sîn-ahu-šubši; Scribe = Sîn-šar-ilāni/Bēl-īpuš

*Note that the family relationships “father” and “brother”, as given in the text, do not (necessarily) correspond to the actual relations. B1 and B2 apparently had not the same father and it remains unclear if and how C1 and C2 could have (partly) been brothers of B1 and B2.

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of silver. Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.7% p.a.). The houses of C1 and C2, both sons of B, are placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-zēri/Aplāya; B = Upāqu/[…]; C1 = Aplāya/Upāqu; C2 = Nabû-šumu-ukīn; Scribe = Marduk-bēl-ilāni/Nabû-zēru-iddin

elementText.text:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases 11 square reed (134.75 m2) of wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 4 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The sold land is located in the Kullaba district (erṣet Kullaba) inside of Babylon. Its upper side borders on a narrow street (sūqu qatnû) and its lower side on the main building of the Akitu festival (bīt rēši akītum). Its upper front borders on the house of C1 and its lower front on the house of C2. 5 witnesses (including another individual, Nabû-šumu-iškun, from the Arkāt-ili-damqu family) and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Arad-Ea; B1 = Nabû-bēlšunu//Nappāhu; B2 = Nabû-bēlšunu//Bēl-ēṭir; C1 = Bēl-nāṣir//Sîn-dayyānu; C2 = Bēl-iqīša, atkuppu (reed worker); Scribe = Nabû-bēlšunu//Arkāt-ili-damqu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1, B2 and B3 owe A1, A2, A3, A4, A5 and A6 3 minas of silver. Beginning with the present month, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 5 shekels (33% p.a.). The debtors mutually guarantee for the repayment of the debt (ištēn pūt šanî našû). An additional clause, literally meaning “whoever sees (the debtors), receives the silver”, possibly refers to “joint creditorship”. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1= Aššur-dannu; A2 = Aya-abū; A3 = Batūl; A4 = Igigi; A5 = Nergalāya; A6 = Damqia; B1= Perˀu; B2 = Šumāya; B3 = Nabû-gāmil; Scribe = Murānu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Purchase of a field: A purchases from B a field (eqlu) for 1/3 mina and [x] shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), including [x] shekel of silver for the seller’s fingernail impression. The description of the bordering areas is not preserved. The plot of land measures 37 x 25 cubits (18.5 x 12.5 m). 11+ witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Perˀu/Šu[…]; B = Šamaš-erība//Eppēš-ilī; Scribe = Abi-maqar//Nabû-ušallim

elementText.text:
Fragmentary document concerning the settlement of a dispute involving money: A dispute involving the parties A and B1 and B2 about slaves (amīlūtu) and an amount of 1 mina and 1/3 shekels of siver is settled in the assembly (puhru) of the mār bānê. The document is sealed in the presence of the prefect (šaknu) of the king (Ṣalam-šarri-iqbi), the prefect of the slaves(?) ([…]-ili) and priest (šangû) of Sîn ([…]-mušebši. Broken witness list.
 
A = Ahu-kiru-ibni; B1 = Sîn-ēṭir; B2 = Gabbi-ilāni-šarru-uṣur

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Kanisurra until the end of the present month for 25 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-šar-ahhēšu, a brother of B) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Aplāya/Ubba; B = Nabû-zēru-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šu; Scribe = […]/Erība

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver: B1 owes A 15 minas of silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). The debt is secured by a pledge which includes: B1’s 1/6 (inheritance) share (zittu) in an orchard; the half share (ahu) of the same orchard, which is the (inheritance) share of B2, the brother of B1; a house in Uruk against which B1 has already drawn silver (nasāhu) for making a payment (eṭēru) on behalf (ana muhhi) of B2; a plot in Babylon which measures 637 square cubits (159.25 m2) and borders on the houses of C1 and C2; (and) the entire assets (nikkassūšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B1. 5+ witnesses and the scribe. In text BM11898 we learn about another 1/6 share of the inheritance of Ahhēa.

A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu//Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Ahhēa//Ṭābia; B2 = Šulāya/Ahhēa//Ṭābia; C1 = Nabû-ušallim//Amati; C2 = Šumāya//Miṣirayyu; Scribe = Aplāya//Šangû-Sippar

elementText.text:
Purchase of field: A purchases a half share of a field (eqlu) for 2 ½ minas of silver from B1 and his mother fB2. The plot of land comprises a date garden (kirî gišimmari) and wasteland (kišubbû) and is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk. Its upper side borders on the city wall (dūr āli), while its lower side, upper front and lower front border on (the properties of) C1, C2 and C3. The upper front also borders on a street (sūqu). No cardinal directions are given in the record. Its upper side measures 350 cubits (175 m), its lower side and upper front 300 cubits (150 m) and its lower front 200 cubits (100 m). The plot presumably is the first half of the land bought by A from B1 and B2 one year later (BM119872). The transaction is concluded in the presence (ina ušuzzi) of the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Balāṭu). 14 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the sellers.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1= Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Kudurru; fB2 = fNasqat; C1 = Zākiru, aškāpu (leatherworker); C2 = Eanna-ibni, pahāru (potter); C2 = Zibāya/Ērešu; Scribe = Bēl-īpuš//Šamaš-bāri

elementText.text:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B1, B2 and B3 two plots of land. First, A purchases 4 square kor (54,000 m2) arable land (zēru), a garden with date palms bearing fruit (kirî gišimmari zaqpi iṣṣi bilti), for 19 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of ½ mina of silver. The sold garden is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of the Zababa Gate in the province (pīhatu) of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the Imgur-Illil Wall and on (the property of) C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the bank (kišādu) of the Bānītu Canal (Nāru-ša-Bānītu) as well as (the property or properties of) C2 and C3. Its upper front (in the west) borders on (the property of) C4 and its lower front (in the east) on the bank of the Bānītu Canal. Second, A purchases 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land, a field in the countryside planted with trees (eqlu ṣēru pî šulpi) for 7 ½ minas of silver. The sold land is located in the meadowland of the Bēl sluice in the province of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on (the property of) C5 and its lower side (in the south) on (the property of) C6. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the bank of the Gubbat Canal (Nāru-ša-Gubbat) and its lower front (in the east) leads up to the dam (makallû) of the hanšû-land. In case the sold land is smaller or bigger than the determined in the present document, the two parties will settle it with each other. 12 witnesses and the scribe (not specified). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the three sellers.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ibni/Bēl-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; B1 = Zēria/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; B2 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; B3 = Nādin/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; C1 = Rēmūtu//Sangû-Ea; C2 = Šākin-šumi//Itinnu; C3 = Tabnēa//Nabû-ēṭir; C4 = Tabnēa//Bā’iru; C5 = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; C6 = Ērišu//Arad-Nergal; Scribe = Nabû-bēl-usāti/Ea-lēˀi//Itinnu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: 1 mina of silver belonging to A are the disposal of (ina pāni) B1 and B2. Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 10 shekels of silver (16.66% p.a.). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-uballiṭ//Erība-Marduk; B1 = Šamaš-uballiṭ//Dummuqu; B2 = Iqīšāya//Iddia; Scribe = Ninurta-ušallim//Nabû-useppi

elementText.text:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases from B wasteland (eqlu kišubbû), for [x] minas and 15 shekels of silver, including silver for [x] kor of barley for the seller’s fingernail impression. The plot is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of LUGAL.GU(D).SI.SÁ inside of GIR.GI.LUM.KI (= Nippur?). Its upper side (in the north) borders on a property of the buyer A and on a house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the property of C2. Its upper front (in the east) borders on the property of C3 and its lower front (in the west) on another property of the buyer. Its upper side measures 34 cubits (17 m), its lower side 30 cubits (15 m), its upper front 32 cubits (16 m) and its lower front 21(?) cubits (10.5 m). 11+ witnesses (including C3) and the scribe, also defined as sealer of the tablet (kānik ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Aplāya//Šumāya; B = Nergal-uballiṭ//Hayānu; C1 = Nergal-uballiṭ//Nabû-ahu-[…]; C2 = Šumu-ibni//[…]; C3 = Ninurta-ašarēdu//Zabūšu; Scribe = Bēl-[…]//Rāši-ili

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute: The dispute between A and B concerning the slave fC and four children is settled before D, the governor of Ur, and the assemblies (puhru) of Babylon, Borsippa and Ur. It has been decided that A receives the slave together with a purchase document.
 
A = Damqia/Šūzubu; B = Kudurru//Kidin-Sîn; fC = fŠāhitti; D = Sîn-balāssu-iqbi, governor of Ur

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 6 shekels of silver. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a prebend (unspecified) before Nanāya beginning with the present day - the time of completion is not preserved. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ibni-Ištar/Bēl-ušallim; B = Lâbâši/Gudadu; Scribe = Šūzubu/Bēl-iqīša

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a prebend: B1 and B2 approach A with a request to take over the service of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for the 10th of Ṭebēt (X). A grants the request and pays 5/6 mina and 2 shekels of silver for the prebend. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Hinnumu). 2 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the two sellers.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/ŠU-zēri; B1 = Purussû/Uprāya; B2 = Šumu-uṣur/Kudurru; Scribe = Ahhēšāya/Bēl-usāti

elementText.text:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 1 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B. The sold house is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the north), its lower side (in the south) and its lower front (in the east) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its upper front (in the west) borders on a house already owned by the buyer. No side lengths are given in the record. 16 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Nanāya-uṣalli; C1 = Šāpiku, ṣāhitu (oilpresser); C2 = Nabû-ēreš//Hašdia; C3 = Ahhēšāya/Nanāya-uṣalli; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Kudurru

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 2 5/6 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold garden is located inside of Uruk. Its lower front (in the south) borders on the moat (harīṣu) of the gate (abullu) of the goddess Irnin(n)a and its lower side (in the west) on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. Its upper side (in the east) borders on (the property of) C. The bordering area of the upper front (in the north) is not specified. The upper front and the lower front each measure 100 cubits (50 m). The upper side is said to be as long as the one of (the property of) the neighbour C. The length of the lower side is not specified. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-nāṣir). 15 witnesses (including the ašlāku [tanner] Nabû-useppi) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.  

A = Lâbâši/Nabû-lēˀi; B = Bēlšunu/Ahhēšāya; C = Bēl-ēṭir; Scribe = Nabû-lēˀi//Iddin-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Purchase of land: A purchases 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land (zēru) in the newly cleared countryside (eqlu ṣēru taptû), forming part of hanšû-land, for 3 2/3 minas and 5 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold land is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of the reed marshes (appāru) of the Bēl sluice (bābi ša Bēl) in the province (pīhatu) of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on (the property of) C1, from the same family as A, and its lower side (in the south) borders on (the property of) the seller B. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the bank (kišādu) of the Gubbat Canal (Nāru-ša-Gubbat) and its lower front (in the east) on (the property of) C2. 8 witnesses (including several members of the Ēppeš-ili family and the Arad-Nergal family) and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B. In case the sold land is smaller than 30 square kor, A will take the missing share from the land of B. In case the sold land is bigger than 30 square kor, B will take the surplus back. Another individual is said to have been present.

A = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Bēl-lēˀi//Ēppeš-ili; B = Ērišu/Nādin//Arad-Nergal; C1 = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; C2 = […]//Mādidu; Scribe = Bēl-usātu//Itinnu

elementText.text: Account dealing with the payments of silver to Ebabbar in Sippar, at least partly for the acquisition of domestic animals. Inter alia a smith (nappāhu) is listed as contributor of a silver amount (broken) and brewers (sirāšu) as well as bakers (nuhatimmu) are mentioned too.

elementText.text:
Legal document concerning the redistribution of dates: 60 kor (10,800 l) of dates from A1 to B1, 30 kor (5,400 l) from A2 to B2, 60 kor (10,800 l) from A3 to B3, 60 kor (10,800 l) from A4 to B4 and B5. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) (Ninurta-šarru-uṣur) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-nādin-ahi). 4 witnesses and the scribe (not specified). According to an additional note C is at the disposal of (ina pāni) D.
 
A1 = Kudurru/Taqbi-līšir; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; A3 = Zēria/Zēru-ukīn; A4 = Nabû-gāmil/Zēru[..]; B1 = Bēl-ēreš; B2 = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Ibnāya; B3 = Mukīn-Innina/Nabû-zēru-iddin; B4 = Marduk-šumu-līšir; B5 = […]; C = Ibni-Ištar; D = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Rēmūtu

elementText.text:
Purchase of orchards and wasteland: A purchases from the house of B gardens and wasteland (kišubbû). One piece of land borders on the Bānītu Canal and on the dam (makallû) of the hanšû-land of C1 as well as on the Piti Canal. A second piece of land borders on the royal road (harrān šarri), the Haṭiṭu Canal beneath (šupālu) Hursag-kalamma and the wide street next to the house of C2. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-eṭēru//Miṣirāya; B = Nūr-Sîn; C1 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Bibēa; C2 = Iddin-Nergal/Bā’iru; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Balāssu/Maštuk

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: The two brothers B1 and B2 as well as B3 owe to (the temples of) Ištar and Nanāya 10 minas of silver. If they fail to pay within due time, the debt will bear an (monthly) interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). Guarantee clause. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = Zabīdāya/Tappûa; B2 = Iddin-Nabû/Tappûa; B3 = Bēl-ahu-iddin/Bēl-upahhir; Scribe = Eanna-šadûnu/Marduk-nāṣir

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 minas of silver during the fourth year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a prebend (unspecified) during the first 6 days of the month Ṭebēt (IX) and the entire assets (mimmûšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). 5 witnesses (another son of Kunāya) and the scribe.
 
A = Ibnāya/Kunāya; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Bēl-ahu-iddin; Scribe = Nidintu/Šumāya

elementText.text:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (kišubbû) for 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The sold land is located in the district of the Great Gate (erṣet bābi rabî) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the south) borders on the house of C1 and its upper front (in the east) on the house(s) of C2 and C3. Its lower side (in the north) and its lower front (in the west) border on the houses of C4 . The lower front also borders a narrow street (sūqu qatnu). The plot covers an area of 33 x 43 cubits (16.5 x 21.5 m). 5 witnesses (including Zabidāya, father of the scribe, and Iddin-Nabû both from the Sîn-leqe-unninnī family) and the scribe. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Naˀid-Marduk). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Rēmūtu/Barbaru; C1 = Balāssu/Marduk-ēṭir; C2 = Balāṭu/ˀAdu; C3 = Iqišāya/Nabû-ahhē-šullim; C4 = Ahu-atâ/Nūrea; Scribe = Apkallu/Zabidāya//Sîn-leqe-unninnī

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. The debt is free of interest (hubuttūtu) for half a year, that is, until the end of the month Kislīm (IX). If B fails to pay by then, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 9 shekels per mina (15% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nūr-Sîn; Scribe = Līdānu//Balīhu

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a half share (ahu) of a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 5 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 10 shekels of silver, from B. The sold garden is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk and actually borders on the Ninurta Temple. No other information about location and seize of the garden is given in the record. The other half of the said garden is already owned by the buyer (BM118972). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 17 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Kudurru; Scribe = Balāṭu/Bēl-lēˀi
